alert.note: Alert for Goliad; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Victoria and Goliad Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 145 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Charco, or 14 miles west of Goliad, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goliad, Fannin, Schroeder, Coleto Creek Park, Ander, Oak Village, Mission Valley, Weesatche, Weser, Nursery and Charco. This includes the following highways... US Highway 183 between mile markers 626 and 652. US Highway 59 between mile markers 645 and 674. US Highway 77 between mile markers 580 and 584. US Highway 87 between mile markers 798 and 804. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south Texas.
